pullRequest.title: Add replicas of default build configs with OpenJDK JSR292 enabled
pullRequest.bodyText:
The default build configs are the ones with no suffix and _xl suffix.
The default build configs are replicated to create new build configs
with OpenJDK JSR292 enabled.
OpenJDK JSR292 is enabled using the following configure option:
--enable-openjdk-methodhandles.
The new build configs will be used to test the support for OpenJDK
JSR292 until it is confirmed to be stable. After confirmation of
stability, the support for OpenJDK JSR292 will be enabled in the default
configs, and the new build configs will be deleted.
#11116 tracks the deletion of new build configs.
Added a missing shortname for zOS: zoslargeheap.
Related: #7352
Co-authored-by: Jack Lu Jack.S.Lu@ibm.com
Signed-off-by: Babneet Singh sbabneet@ca.ibm.com

commit.message:
Add a new Linux x86-64 build with OpenJDK MethodHandles (JSR292) enabled

Related: https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/issues/7352

Co-authored-by: Jack Lu <Jack.S.Lu@ibm.com>
Signed-off-by: Babneet Singh <sbabneet@ca.ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText: Seems to be a non-292 change here. I guess you're just adding a missed shortname for zos.

commit.message:
Add replicas of default build configs with OpenJDK JSR292 enabled

The default build configs are the ones with no suffix and "_xl" suffix.

The default build configs are replicated to create new build configs
with OpenJDK JSR292 enabled.

OpenJDK JSR292 is enabled using the following configure option:
"--enable-openjdk-methodhandles".

The new build configs will be used to test the support for OpenJDK
JSR292 until it is confirmed to be stable. After confirmation of
stability, the support for OpenJDK JSR292 will be enabled in the default
configs, and the new build configs will be deleted.

Co-authored-by: Jack Lu <Jack.S.Lu@ibm.com>
Signed-off-by: Babneet Singh <sbabneet@ca.ibm.com>
